channel.title: Ways of mankind
channel.description:
This series is an exploration into the origin and development of cultures, customs and folkways in various parts of the world.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Case of the sea lion flippers
item.description: This program, "The Case of the Sea-Lion Flippers," discusses ethics among the Yurok people.
item.dc:creator: Goldschmidt, Walter, 1913-2010
item.dc:subject: Yurok mythology

item.title: Sticks and stones
item.description: This program, "Sticks and Stones," discusses the nature of religious belief.
item.dc:creator: Goldschmidt, Walter, 1913-2010
item.dc:subject: Sociology

item.title: Desert soliloquy
item.description: This program, "Desert Soliliquy," tells the story of a Hopi Indian and the family customs that went into making him who he was.
item.dc:creator: Goldschmidt, Walter, 1913-2010
item.dc:subject: Sociology

item.title: When Greek meets Greek
item.description: This program, "When Greek Meets Greek," discusses ancient Greek values and how they were perpetuated.
item.dc:creator: Sinclair, Lister
item.dc:subject: Values--History

item.title: You're not alone
item.description: This program, "You're Not Alone," discusses how humans form into groups and the various types of groups that can exist.
item.dc:creator: Goldschmidt, Walter, 1913-2010
item.dc:subject: Sociology

item.title: Legend of the longhouse
item.description: "A Legend of the Longhouse" is a study in authority, based on an Iroquois legend.
item.dc:creator: Sinclair, Lister
item.dc:subject: Theater & Drama

item.title: Legend of the longhouse
item.description: "A Legend of the Longhouse" is a study in authority, based on an Iroquois legend.
item.dc:creator: Sinclair, Lister
item.dc:subject: Sociology

item.title: But I know what I like
item.description: "But I Know What I Like" is a study in the arts and how artistic standards vary by culture.
item.dc:creator: Sinclair, Lister
item.dc:subject: U.S. Literature

item.title: Stand in for a murderer
item.description: This program, "Stand in for a Murderer," attempts to show the different ways that cultures deal with issues in order to help listeners understand and respect cultural differences.
item.dc:creator: Goldschmidt, Walter, 1913-2010
item.dc:subject: Theater & Drama

item.title: Word in your ear
item.description: This program discusses the vast variety of extant languages, as well as the variables that exist within each language.
item.dc:creator: Goldschmidt, Walter, 1913-2010
item.dc:subject: Speech & Language
